title: Panama Ex-President Martinelli Granted Asylum in Nicaragua
description: Former Panama President Ricardo Martinelli was granted political asylum in Nicaragua on Wednesday after a high court ruling against him that threatens to upend the presidential election in which he was the frontrunner.

title: Labour to Announce Shift on £28 Billion Green Investment Plan
description: Labour leader Keir Starmer is expected to announce changes to his £28 billion ($35 billion) green investment pledge, after weeks of internal wrangling over whether to roll back the costly flagship policy.

title: Republican Turmoil Over Border, Ukraine Aid Consumes Congress
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, congressional correspondent Steven T. Dennis looks at the Republican disarray in Congress. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: US Kills Commander of Iran-Backed Proxy Group in Iraq Strike
description: The US conducted an airstrike that killed the commander of an Iran-backed militia in Iraq, as the Biden administration pressed ahead with its campaign to target those responsible for the killing of three US soldiers last month.

title: Five US Marines Missing After Helicopter Found in California
description: A search-and-rescue operation is underway for five US Marines whose helicopter was found in a remote area of California, authorities said.

title: Why China Is Limping Into the Year of the Dragon
description: Beijing hasn’t hit on the right mix of policies to reawaken the animal spirits.

title: Blinken Says Hamas Response on Hostages Opens Space for Deal
description: Israel and the US offered conflicting interpretations of Hamas’s response to a proposal to pause fighting and release dozens of hostages, with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu seeming to reject it out of hand and Secretary of State Antony Blinken saying it opened space for a deal.

title: Senate Vote Ends Border Deal Prospects
description: The Senate delivered a death blow to efforts to impose new border restrictions, blocking a carefully negotiated bipartisan compromise after former president Donald Trump and House Republican leaders denounced the deal.

title: Haley Dismisses Nevada Loss, Calling Primary Process ‘Rigged’ for Trump
description: Nikki Haley dismissed an embarrassing loss in Nevada’s Republican presidential primary, saying the state’s nominating process had been “rigged” in favor of rival Donald Trump.

title: US Debt Set to Skyrocket to Record Over Next Decade, CBO Says
description: US debt held by the public is expected to hit an all-time high in the next 10 years, amid burgeoning costs for mandatory programs and net interest payments, according to the Congressional Budget Office.

title: Ghana’s Vice President Takes Aim at Top Job With Digital Shoutout
description: Ghanaian Vice President Mahamudu Bawumia, vying to be the West African nation’s next leader, touted technology as key to achieving a smaller and more efficient government.

title: UN Launches $4.1 Billion Humanitarian Appeal for Sudan
description: The United Nations is appealing for $4.1 billion to meet critical humanitarian needs in war-torn Sudan.

title: Chinese Hackers Embedded in US Networks for at Least Five Years
description: The Chinese state-sponsored hacking group known as Volt Typhoon has been living in the networks of some critical industries for “at least five years,” according to a joint cybersecurity advisory issued by the US and its allies on Wednesday.

title: UK Officials Prepare Fresh Sewage Crackdown With New Water Plan
description: The UK government is preparing to announce new measures to clean up rivers and waterways in a bid to show it’s cracking down on polluting sewage companies.

title: Europe Is Preparing for a Transatlantic Trade Fight With Trump
description: European Union countries have started internal discussions over how to respond to punitive measures that may hit the bloc if Donald Trump wins the US election in November.

title: Senegal’s Fury Over Delayed Election Adds to West Africa Unrest
description: Senegal is teetering on the brink of crisis after lawmakers voted to delay elections and extend the final term of President Macky Sall by nearly a year — a move opponents have characterized as a “constitutional coup.”

title: A Valentine’s Gift: The Readout With Allegra Stratton
description: Some cheery news from the respected National Institute of Economic and Social Research this morning: UK living standards will improve as inflation falls to 1.2% in the second quarter and the Bank of England starts to cut rates in May, according to forecasts in its quarterly report.

title: Biden Poised to Restrict Americans’ Personal Data Going to China
description: The Biden administration intends to unveil as soon as next week a new effort to prevent foreign adversaries such as China from accessing troves of Americans’ sensitive personal data, according to people familiar with the planned executive order.

title: Chesapeake CEO Says Biden’s LNG Review Hurts Consumers and US Allies
description: The Biden administration’s pause on new licenses to export liquefied natural gas will hurt consumers, the environment and US allies, according to the head of one of the country’s top gas producers.

title: Sheinbaum Adviser Drafts Plan to Put Women into Mexico Workforce
description: Mexico needs a mostly state-funded social program that would enable more women to enter the workforce, an adviser to presidential frontrunner Claudia Sheinbaum said in an interview.

title: Surveillance: Zombie Worries Keeping Traders Stuck in No Man's Land
description: Tony Dwyer at Canaccord Genuity says the zombie economy is creating incredible uncertainty in stocks

title: US Is Convinced It Can Push Ukraine Aid Through Congress, Sullivan Says
description: The Biden administration remains confident that it can win congressional approval for aid to Kyiv, National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan said, after a bipartisan immigration and Ukraine support bill was torpedoed this week by House Republicans.

title: South Korea President Says Dior Bag Incident Was Political Move
description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol said the presentation of a designer bag to the first lady was a “political maneuver,” trying to stem public anger over the incident that has hit voter sentiment.

title: Sunak’s Trans Jibe Backfires With Victim’s Mother in Parliament
description: Rishi Sunak triggered outrage in the House of Commons with a jibe about Labour Party leader Keir Starmer’s stance on gender identity, as the mother of a murdered transgender teenager attended Parliament.

title: Sunak's Taunt Backfires: Starmer Calls Shame Over PM's Trans Comment
description: Get caught up on the day’s political news

title: Lithuania Accuses China of Pressure Campaign Over Visa Blockage
description: Lithuania’s top diplomat accused the Chinese government of engaging in a pressure campaign against the Baltic nation after Beijing suspended the issuance of visas to its citizens without explanation.

title: G-7 Aiming to Force Russian Oil Away From Shadow Fleet, UK Government Official Says
description: A UK official said that Group of Seven nations are aiming to curb Russia’s ability to use a vast shadow fleet of tankers to deliver its oil, the latest sign of a ramp up in western sanctions on Moscow.

title: Ukrainian Parliament Backs New Mobilization Rules
description: Ukraine’s parliament gave preliminary approval for a controversial bill on mobilization, designed to help replenish the country’s war-battered armed forces.

title: Schumer to Push Aid to Ukraine and Israel Without a Border Deal
description: Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer plans to force a Senate vote on a package of aid for Ukraine, Israel and Taiwan without ties to US border funding after an initial test vote on a larger deal fails Wednesday, per a senior Democratic aide.

title: China Grabs Spotlight With Major Presence at Saudi Weapons Show
description: A Chinese-made J-10 fighter aircraft soared into the sky as part of a showcase at Saudi Arabia’s annual arms exhibition, demonstrating the growing defense ties between the Asian power and the world’s fifth-biggest weapons spender.

title: Biden’s EV Tax Credits Are a Ripe Target for Gutting If Trump Wins
description: A second Trump administration could tighten the rules for the $7,500 credits so fewer cars qualify, undercutting a key piece of Democrats’ Inflation Reduction Act.

title: Lawmakers Question Chip Grant to BAE Over Firm’s Stock Buybacks
description: Two Democratic lawmakers are raising concerns about a history of stock buybacks at BAE Systems Plc, the parent of the first recipient of US subsidies for semiconductor production.

title: UN Partners on Business Plan to Hire Migrants in Mexico
description: A group of 46 companies pledged to hire migrants in Mexico with the help of the United Nation’s migration agency, a move intended to give employment to some of the thousands of foreigners who have in recent years settled in the Latin American nation.

title: Argentina Bonds Slump as Milei Reforms Go Back to Square One
description: Argentina bonds dropped in early trading after the country’s governing coalition sent President Javier Milei’s reform package back to square one in congress after realizing they didn’t have enough votes to push it through the lower house.

title: Soaring UK Migration Gives Hunt Up to £18 Billion for Tax Cuts
description: Soaring migration to the UK could hand Chancellor Jeremy Hunt an £18 billion ($22.7 billion) windfall for tax cuts in next month’s budget by lifting economic growth, according to new analysis.

title: EU Starts Legal Procedure Against Hungary’s Sovereignty Law
description: The European Union launched a legal procedure against Hungary over its “sovereignty-protection” law, which independent media and civil groups have said was aimed at intimidating them under Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s rule.

title: Iran Diplomat Likens Link With Militia Proxies to NATO Alliance
description: An Iranian diplomat likened Tehran’s alliance of militias across the Middle East to NATO, though denied his country has direct control over the groups as they brace for more US strikes against them.

title: Winning Elections In Europe Is Easier Than Governing
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.

title: Ramaphosa to Announce South African Election Date by Feb. 23
description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa will announce the date for national elections by Feb. 23, according to his spokesman.

title: Inside Turkish Central Banker Downfall That Was Months in Making
description: Turkish central bankers long played to an audience of one.

title: Two Former Polish Lawmakers Seek to Break Into Parliament
description: Two former Polish lawmakers tried to force their way into parliament despite their mandates being revoked in the latest standoff between the government of Prime Minister Donald Tusk and the nationalist opposition.

title: Biden Attends New York Fundraisers for Cash to Fight Trump
description: President Joe Biden will attend a trio of fundraisers hosted by New York doctors and financiers, including Willett Advisors LLC Chief Executive Officer Steve Rattner, as he looks to extend his cash advantage over Republican rival Donald Trump.

title: South African Poll Shows ANC Losing Majority, Gains for EFF
description: South Africa’s ruling party looks set to lose its outright majority in national elections for the first time since 1994, while support for the populist Economic Freedom Fighters may rise, an Ipsos poll found.

title: Sweden Scraps Probe Into Nord Stream Gas Pipeline Blasts
description: The sabotage of two undersea gas pipelines in 2022 remains a mystery as Sweden ended a probe without reaching any clear conclusions on the identity of the perpetrators.

title: Bomb Blasts on Eve of Pakistan Polls Raise Fear of Violence
description: Two bomb blasts targeting the offices of different political leaders killed at least 20 people in Pakistan’s northwest Balochistan province, raising security concerns a day before national elections.

title: Iceland Holds Rates as Wages, Volcano Impact Fan Price Fears
description: Iceland’s central bank kept its benchmark rate at the highest level since 2009 to ensure inflation continues on a downward path even as risks from wage talks and volcanic activity threaten to cause a resurgence price gains.

title: Switzerland Asks China to Join Meeting on Ending War in Ukraine
description: Switzerland said it asked China to participate in a peace conference on the war in Ukraine, stepping up pressure on Beijing to play a role in ending the fighting nearly two years after the conflict began.

title: Sanctioned Russian Tycoon Usmanov Loses EU Court Appeal
description: Russian metals tycoon Alisher Usmanov lost his fight against European sanctions over his links to President Vladimir Putin, the EU’s General Court ruled Wednesday dismissing the appeal.

title: A Bombing in Pakistan Kills 14 Ahead of National Elections
description: QUETTA, Pakistan (AP) — A pair of bombings at the election offices of a political party and an independent candidate in southwest Pakistan killed at least 24 people and wounded more than two dozen others, officials said Wednesday, the day before parliamentary elections are to be held.

title: Some Russian Banks May Have Swapped Gold for Dollars, Report Says
description: Some Russian banks appear to have maneuvered around a ban on shipping dollars and euros to the country by trading gold in the United Arab Emirates and Turkey, according to research from a financial-intelligence company.

title: Air Defense Working in Kyiv Amid Russian Missile Barrage
description: Missile debris damaged two high voltage power lines in Kyiv, resulting in power supply cuts to some consumers, mayor Vitali Klitschko said on Telegram. One person was injured in Kyiv as explosions and air raid alert continue on Wednesday morning.

title: Jokowi Bets Indonesia Legacy on Prabowo Winning Vote Next Week
description: President Joko Widodo is making a gamble on his preferred successor winning Indonesia’s election in one round, even as the wager risks dividing his supporters, denting his credibility and curbing the influence he has built in the past decade.

title: Trump Team Targets European Union for Punishing Trade Measures
description: Donald Trump is targeting the European Union for a potential slew of punitive trade measures designed to address long-standing grievances should he retake office, according to people familiar with his team’s nascent economic-platform discussions.

title: Haley Suffers Loss in Nevada GOP Primary as Biden Cruises to Easy Win
description: President Joe Biden secured an easy victory and Nikki Haley suffered an embarrassing loss in the largely symbolic Democratic and Republican Nevada presidential primaries on Tuesday.

title: Azerbaijani Ruler Seeks New Term in Snap Vote After Karabakh Win
description: Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev is poised to extend his rule well into a third decade at snap elections Wednesday in the energy-rich Caspian nation.

title: Syria Says Israeli Airstrikes Over Homs Killed and Wounded Civilians
description: DAMASCUS, Syria (AP) — Israeli airstrikes over the central city of Homs and its countryside late Tuesday killed and wounded civilians, the Syrian military said.

title: Congressman Left Hospital Bed to Head Off Mayorkas Impeachment
description: Representative Al Green delivered the dramatic tie vote Tuesday night that prevented US House Republicans from impeaching Homeland Security Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas.

title: Republican Party Chair In Talks to Step Down Amid Trump Pressure
description: Republican National Committee Chairwoman Ronna McDaniel is in discussions with party leadership to step down by the end of this month after facing pressure from the party’s 2024 presidential front-runner Donald Trump, according to people familiar with the plans.

title: Philippine Defense Head Seeks to Boost Military Site Near Taiwan
description: The Philippines aims to boost military presence and infrastructure in the country’s northernmost province near Taiwan, according to its defense chief, amid tensions with Beijing over the South China Sea.

title: Biden Trade Chief Calls Tariffs ‘Important Defensive Tool’
description: President Joe Biden’s trade chief called tariffs an “important defensive tool” for rebalancing unfair commercial relationships, a nod to the value of duties on exports from China as the administration considers changes.

title: Saudi Says No Israeli Ties Unless Gaza ‘Aggression’ Halted
description: Saudi Arabia’s foreign ministry informed President Joe Biden’s administration there will be no diplomatic ties with Israel unless the “aggression” against Gaza is stopped and Israel recognizes the Palestinian state on the 1967 borders with East Jerusalem as the capital.

title: US Tells China Yellen Wants to Visit This Year as Ties Stabilize
description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen wants to visit China this year, a US delegation told Chinese officials in Beijing, a sign that ties between the two economic superpowers are further stabilizing.

title: US Senators Accuse McKinsey, BCG of Hindering PGA-LIV Probe
description: US senators criticized top executives at McKinsey & Co. and the Boston Consulting Group for not fully cooperating with an investigation into the merger of the PGA Tour with Saudi Arabia-backed LIV Golf.
